justification: “We let deciders rate their emotions directly after receiving feedback on a three dimensions scale… The dimensions are valence… We elicit those dimensions with the Self-Assessment Manikin (SAM).”
The same passage notes that arousal is one of the three emotion dimensions “elicited with the Self-Assessment Manikin (SAM).”
The emotion dimensions include dominance “from powerless to powerful,” and these are “elicited with the Self-Assessment Manikin (SAM).”
“GASP A measure of guilt and shame proneness (Cohen et al., 2011)… gives insights into how individuals differ in their emotional responses to situations involving moral or social transgressions.”
The same sentence describes GASP as “a measure of guilt and shame proneness,” indicating it captures both constructs.
“HPRS A measure of reactance… The scale assesses various aspects of psychological reactance, such as feelings of resistance, anger, and opposition to perceived threats to one's freedom.”
“Big5 A short measure of personality along the Big Five in 15 questions (Rammstedt and John, 2007).”
“WVS A measure of economic values from the World Value Survey… contrasts collectivist and individualist attitudes.”
